014package org.gbif.api.util;
015
016import java.util.stream.Stream;
017
018import org.junit.jupiter.params.ParameterizedTest;
019import org.junit.jupiter.params.provider.Arguments;
020import org.junit.jupiter.params.provider.MethodSource;
021
022import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertEquals;
023import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertNull;
024import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertTrue;
025import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.fail;
026
027public class SearchTypeValidatorDoubleRangeTest {
028
029  public static Stream<Arguments> data() {
030    return Stream.of(
031        Arguments.of("10.3", null, null),
032        Arguments.of("10,20", 10d, 20d),
033        Arguments.of("*,20", null, 20d),
034        Arguments.of("10, *", 10d, null),
035        Arguments.of("10.1,20.2", 10.1d, 20.2d),
036        Arguments.of("-1,2.0432", -1d, 2.0432d),
037        Arguments.of("peter", null, null)
038    );
039  }
040
041  @ParameterizedTest
042  @MethodSource("data")
043  public void testRange(String arg, Double start, Double end) {
044    try {
045      Range<Double> range = SearchTypeValidator.parseDecimalRange(arg);
046      if (start == null && end == null) {
047        fail(arg + " supposed to be an invalid range");
048      } else {
049        // test parse result
050        if (range.hasLowerBound()) {
051          assertEquals(start, range.lowerEndpoint());
052        } else {
053          assertNull(start);
054        }
055
056        if (range.hasUpperBound()) {
057          assertEquals(end, range.upperEndpoint());
058        } else {
059          assertNull(end);
060        }
061
062        assertTrue(SearchTypeValidator.isNumericRange(arg));
063      }
064
065    } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
066      // expected?
067      if (start != null || end != null) {
068        fail(arg + " supposed to be a valid range");
069      }
070    }
071  }
072}
